title: 2009-2013 ACS PUMS DATA DICTIONARY

var_codes.H: Housing Record or Group Quarters Unit

PUMA00.description: Public use microdata area code (PUMA) based on Census 2000 definition for data collected prior to 2012. Use in combination with PUMA10.

var_codes.-0009: Code classification is Not Applicable because data collected in 2012 or later

notes: Note: Public Use Microdata Areas (PUMAs) designate areas of 100,000 or more
population.  Use with ST for unique code. PUMA00 applies to data collected in
calendar years 2011 and earlier. Users of multi-year datasets that contain data
from before and after 2012 should use PUMA00 and PUMA10 together where possible,
but not all PUMAs will be comparable. See http://tigerweb.geo.census.gov to
identify PUMA changes between the two vintages.

ADJHSG.description: Adjustment factor for housing dollar amounts (6 implied decimal places)

NP.description: Number of person records following this housing record

var_codes.01: One person record (one person in household or any person in group quarters)
var_codes.02..20: Number of person records (number of persons in household)

var_codes.001: Included in rent or in condo fee
var_codes.003: No charge or gas not used

notes: Note: Use values from ADJHSG to adjust GASP values 4 and over to constant dollars.

var_codes.9: Case is from Puerto Rico in 2013 or later, RWAT not applicable

SMP.description: Total payment on all second and junior mortgages and home equity loans (monthly amount)

var_codes.bbbbb: N/A (GQ/vacant/not owned or being bought/ no second or junior mortgages or home equity loans)

notes: Note: Use ADJHSG to adjust SMP to constant dollars.
*  In cases where the SOC occupation code ends in X(s) or Y(s), two or more SOC
occupation codes were aggregated to correspond to a specific Census occupation
code. In these cases, the Census occupation description is used for the SOC
** These codes are pseudo codes developed by the Census Bureau and are not
official or equivalent NAICS or SOC codes.
